text: Pediococcus claussenii is a species of Gram-positive bacteria. Like other Pediococcus species, P. claussenii is implicated in the spoilage of fermented beverages due to its production of diacetyl. Strains of this species were originally isolated from spoiled beer. The genome of P. claussenii strain ATCC BAA-344 has been sequenced. ==References== ==External links== *Type strain of Pediococcus claussenii at BacDive - the Bacterial Diversity Metadatabase Category:Lactobacillaceae Category:Bacteria described in 2002
title: Pediococcus claussenii
